usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script creates instances using the `_kModelSpace` constant within the `dbCreate` function during the `_bOnInsert` phase. It operates directly on `Element` and `GenBeam` entities to generate production data (tools like `ElemMill`, `ElemSaw`, `Drill`). It uses `assignToElementGroup` to attach to the model element. There is no usage of `_kPaperSpace`, `_Viewport`, `sd_` prefixes, or drawing view logic typical of ShopDrawing scripts.

opmProperties.description: |Depth of mill and saw line.| |Zero will take the thickness of the zone|

scriptPurpose.summary: Automatically applies linear machining (drills, slots, or cuts) across an element based on a user-defined grid of horizontal and vertical planes.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Creating evenly spaced holes for services or slots for framing connections across multiple studs or joists within a wall or floor element.

parameters.name: sFilterType
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines if the 'Filter beams with beamcode' list acts as a whitelist (only these beams) or blacklist (not these beams).
parameters.affectsOutput: Filters which beams within the selected element receive the machining.

parameters.name: sFilterBC
parameters.businessMeaning: A list of beam codes (e.g., 'STUD', 'JST') to target for tooling, supporting wildcards like '*'.
parameters.affectsOutput: Selects specific GenBeams within the element to be machined.

parameters.name: sHorizontalPlanePositions
parameters.businessMeaning: Semicolon-separated list of Y-axis offsets from the element origin, defining planes perpendicular to the element's X-axis (length).
parameters.affectsOutput: Defines the location of vertical grid lines where tools intersect beams.

parameters.name: sVerticalPlanePositions
parameters.businessMeaning: Semicolon-separated list of X-axis offsets from the element origin, defining planes perpendicular to the element's Y-axis (width).
parameters.affectsOutput: Defines the location of horizontal grid lines where tools intersect beams.

parameters.name: propToolType
parameters.businessMeaning: The specific CNC operation to perform at the intersection points.
parameters.validRange: Frame drill, Mill line, Saw line, Marker line
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines if the script creates holes, slots, cuts, or markups.

parameters.name: propZoneIndex
parameters.businessMeaning: The specific material layer (zone) of the element to apply the machining to (e.g., inner leaf of a cavity wall).
parameters.affectsOutput: Constrains the tooling to the geometry of the specific zone.

parameters.name: toolIndex
parameters.businessMeaning: Reference number for the specific tool in the machine's library.
parameters.affectsOutput: Assigns the tool number in the production data.

parameters.name: dDiameterDrill
parameters.businessMeaning: Diameter of the drill bit used when 'Frame drill' is selected.
parameters.affectsOutput: Sets the diameter of the hole.

parameters.name: propToolDepth
parameters.businessMeaning: Depth of the mill or saw cut. A value of 0 defaults to the full thickness of the zone.
parameters.validRange: 0 (Auto) or positive values up to zone thickness
parameters.affectsOutput: Controls how deep the mill or saw penetrates the material.

parameters.name: extraToolDepth
parameters.businessMeaning: Additional depth added to the base tool depth, useful for ensuring through-cuts.
parameters.affectsOutput: Increases the total depth of the cut.

parameters.name: propToolSide
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines the side of the path profile the tool applies to relative to the path direction.
parameters.affectsOutput: Affects the lateral position of the tool relative to the grid line.

parameters.name: propTurningDirection
parameters.businessMeaning: The direction of tool rotation or feed relative to the grain of the timber.

parameters.name: propOvershoot
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines if the tool should extend slightly beyond the calculated intersection to ensure clean edges.
parameters.affectsOutput: Extends the start and end points of the machining path.

parameters.name: nColor
parameters.businessMeaning: CAD color index for the visual representation of the grid and symbol.
parameters.affectsOutput: Visual only; changes model display color.

parameters.name: dSymbolSize
parameters.businessMeaning: Size of the helper symbol drawn in the model.

parameterDependencies.effect: Enables drill-specific parameters and disables milling/sawing parameters.
Enables cut-specific parameters and disables drill diameter.
Automatically calculates cut depth based on the thickness of 'propZoneIndex'.

outputEntities.description: A cylindrical hole placed through the beam at the intersection of the grid plane and the beam centerline.
A slot or rectangular cut applied along the intersection of the grid plane and the element zone profile.
A straight saw cut applied along the intersection of the grid plane and the element zone profile.
A marker line applied to the surface for layout purposes.
Interactive points in the model allowing the user to drag the grid planes to adjust offsets dynamically.

workflowDiagram: Script inserted via command or catalog.
Check if Execute Key exists in catalog.
[Conditional] If Execute Key invalid or missing: Show Properties Dialog.
Save properties to '_LastInserted' catalog.
Prompt user to Select Elements (ModelSpace).
Loop through selected elements.
Remove any existing instances of this script attached to the elements.
Create new script instance attached to each selected element.
Load properties from '_LastInserted' catalog into new instances.
Delete the temporary insert instance.
[Re-execute] Instance runs in attached context.
Parse Filter properties (Type, BeamCodes).
Parse Grid properties (Horizontal/Vertical positions).
Filter GenBeams within the Element based on BeamCodes and dummy status.
Generate geometry for Grid Planes (Horizontal/Vertical) based on positions.
[Conditional] Check for Grip Point changes (dragged grid lines).
If Grip Changed: Update Grid position arrays based on new grip location.
Calculate intersection of Grid Planes with Zone Profile.
Draw visualization of Grid Planes.
[Conditional] Branch based on 'Tool Type' property.
Apply Frame Drill: Calculate intersection of Planes with filtered Beams. Create Drill tools.
OR Apply Mill/Saw/Marker: Create tools along intersection segments on Element Zone.
Update OPM properties (Grid positions) from calculated geometry.
Draw Script Symbol visualization.

path1.name: Include Mode
steps: Process ONLY beams matching the filter list.

path2.name: Exclude Mode
steps: Process ALL beams EXCEPT those matching the filter list.

path1.name: Frame Drill
steps: Find intersection of Grid Planes with Beam centerlines.

path2.name: Mill/Saw/Marker Line
steps: Intersect Grid Planes with Element Zone Profile.
Create tool path along the intersection segments.

path1.name: Zero/Auto
steps: Retrieve thickness of the specific Zone Index.

validationRules.errorMessage: None explicitly shown, but script erases instance if no elements found (_Element.length() == 0).
validationRules.recovery: Select valid element and re-run script.

validationRules.errorMessage: None explicit. If filter results in 0 beams, script continues but produces no tools.
validationRules.recovery: Adjust Filter Type or Filter Beamcode properties.

validationRules.errorMessage: None explicit. Empty position strings result in no tools.
validationRules.recovery: Enter valid semicolon-separated numbers in Horizontal/Vertical positions.

validationRules.errorMessage: Script clamps Zone Index values > 5 to 5 - value (logic specific to certain element types, though array definition is 1-10).
validationRules.recovery: Ensure Zone Index matches actual element construction.

postInsertionActions.effect: Drag square grips along the grid lines. The 'Horizontal positions' or 'Vertical positions' property strings update automatically to reflect the new offset (in mm).
Changing 'Filter type' or 'Filter beams with beamcode' immediately regenerates tools, adding or removing machining from specific beams.
Switching between 'Frame drill' and 'Mill/Saw' changes the target entity (Beam vs Element) and the type of tool generated.
Changing Diameter, Depth, Side, or Overshoot immediately updates the geometry of the existing tools.
Modifying the 'Horizontal positions' or 'Vertical positions' strings moves the grid lines and associated tools to the new coordinates.

data.markdown:
# HSB_E-GridTooling.mcr

## Overview
This script automatically applies linear machining operations (drills, mill slots, or saw cuts) across an element based on a user-defined grid of planes. It is designed to efficiently create evenly spaced holes for services or slots for framing connections across multiple studs or joists within a wall or floor element.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | This script must be inserted into the 3D model and attached to an Element. |
| Paper Space | No | This script does not function in layout views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | This script modifies production data, not drawing views. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities:** An `Element` (containing `GenBeams`) must exist in the model.
- **Minimum Beam Count:** 0 (The script filters existing beams; it does not create them).
- **Required Settings:** None specific to external files, though machine catalogs should be available if specific tool indices are needed.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Browse and select `HSB_E-GridTooling.mcr`.

### Step 2: Configure Initial Settings
If running from the TSL Insert command (and not a predefined catalog entry), a properties dialog may appear.
1.  Select the **Tool type** (e.g., Frame drill, Mill line).
2.  Set the **Zone index** to target the correct layer of the element.
3.  Click OK to proceed.

### Step 3: Select Elements
```
Command Line: Select elements
Action: Click on the Element(s) in the model you wish to apply the grid tooling to. Press Enter to confirm selection.
```

### Step 4: Adjust Grid and Parameters
1.  Select the newly created script instance (look for the symbol/visuals on the element).
2.  Open the **Properties Palette** (Ctrl+1).
3.  Modify the **Horizontal positions** or **Vertical positions** to define the grid offsets (in mm), or drag the grid lines directly in the model.
4.  Use the **Filter beams with beamcode** property to restrict tooling to specific studs (e.g., "STUD").

## Properties Panel Parameters

### Selection
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Filter type | dropdown | Include | Determines if the Beam Code list acts as a whitelist (Include) or blacklist (Exclude). |
| Filter beams with beamcode | text | | List of beam codes to target (e.g., "STUD;JST"). Supports wildcards (*). |

### Position
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Horizontal positions | text | | Semicolon-separated list of Y-axis offsets (perpendicular to element length). |
| Vertical positions | text | 500 | Semicolon-separated list of X-axis offsets (perpendicular to element width). |

### Tooling
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Tool type | dropdown | Frame drill | Select operation: Frame drill, Mill line, Saw line, or Marker line. |
| Zone index | dropdown | 1 | The specific material layer of the element to machine (1-10). |
| Tool index | number | 1 | Reference number for the specific tool in the machine library. |
| Diameter | number | 18 | Diameter of the drill bit (only used for Frame drill). |
| Depth | number | 0 | Depth of the mill or saw cut. 0 defaults to full zone thickness. |
| Extra depth | number | 0 | Additional depth added to the base cut depth. |
| Tool side | dropdown | Left | Side of the path profile the tool applies to (Left or Right). |
| Turning direction | dropdown | Against course | Rotation/feed direction relative to timber grain. |
| Overshoot | dropdown | Yes | Extends the tool path slightly beyond the intersection for clean edges. |

### Visualisation
| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Color | number | 4 | CAD color index for the grid lines and symbols. |
| Symbol size | number | 40 | Size of the helper symbol drawn in the model. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| None | This script does not add custom context menu items. Use standard Properties or Grips to edit. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: N/A
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: This script does not rely on external XML settings files. It uses the `_LastInserted` catalog to remember settings between uses.

## Tips
- **Dynamic Adjustment:** You can drag the square **Grip Points** on the grid lines in the model view to move them. The "Horizontal positions" and "Vertical positions" properties will automatically update with the new offsets.
- **Through-Cuts:** Leave the **Depth** set to `0` to automatically calculate the correct depth based on the thickness of the material zone you selected.
- **Filtering:** If you only want to drill the top plates of a wall and not the studs, set the **Filter type** to "Exclude" and enter the stud beam code (e.g., "STUD") in the **Filter beams with beamcode** field.
- **Grid Setup:** Enter positions as a semicolon-separated string (e.g., `500; 1000; 1500`) to create multiple lines at once.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why don't I see any holes generated?**
- **A:** Check if your **Filter beams with beamcode** matches the actual beams in the element. If using "Include", ensure the beam codes match exactly. Also, verify that your Grid Position offsets actually intersect with the beams in the element.
- **Q: Can I use this for a single hole?**
- **A:** Yes. Simply enter a single value in the Horizontal or Vertical positions property.
- **Q: What happens if I change the Tool Type?**
- **A:** Switching from "Frame drill" to "Mill line" changes the target entity from the individual Beams to the Element Zone. Ensure your Zone Index is correct for Mill/Saw operations.
